text: hello this is chef john from food
whooshes comm with a quick and easy
peach sweet and sour sauce
you guys saw this sauce on my duck
sous-vide video couple weeks ago and i
promised to show you how I put it
together so here it is a couple
tablespoons of peach preserves now mine
had a little bit of ginger in it and I
think a little bit of orange zest but
any variety you find will work you can
also use apricot for this I put a little
pinch of cayenne you know because when
don't I put a little pinch of cayenne
then a splash of vinegar about one
tablespoon and then some chicken broth
about three tablespoons I'm going to
give that a little whisk with my kinky
whisk okay so the proportions here are
like one two three one part vinegar two
parts preserves three part stock put
this over medium-high heat and boil it
for about five minutes until it reduces
and that's basically the recipe now
during that five minutes you got time to
think think about what what else you
might want to put in it here I put a
little pinch of Chinese five-spice
because I just love that flavor with
duck just such a natural combination by
the way you don't have to serve this hot
or warm this is perfectly fine at room
temperature so you can make this ahead
of time sometimes I refer to these
sauces in the past as guest streaks
which is kind of like French and
intimidating so I'm figuring why why am
I using a French term that nobody knows
it's a simple sweet-and-sour sauce this
is all it is and after five minutes of
boiling that's what it look like
you take it you drizzle it over your
meat awesome a duck quail squab pheasant
any kind of wild game just amazing
chicken of course pork yes absolutely
really good and that's it and I'll write
that proportion down for you on food
wishes calm that 1 2 3 ratio it works
every time works with any jam any
vinegar super super easy
sauce idea I hope give that a try and as
always enjoy
